results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 034
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Orchids under the Southern Cross - Sixth World Orchid Conference in Sydney features Australian orchids. New Look at Old Crafts - traditional skills of Papua-New Guinea potters and weavers adapted to modern trade

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 033. Who's for tennis?
results.brief_description: Looks at the interest shown in tennis in Australia from children learning the basics of the game, to champions such as Emerson and Roche playing off in competition at the White City Courts. Fresh air, exercise and making new friends attract people to the game.
results.description: Looks at the interest shown in tennis in Australia from children learning the basics of the game, to champions such as Emerson and Roche playing off in competition at the White City Courts. Fresh air, exercise and making new friends attract people to the game.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 031. Maryborough and hinterl
results.brief_description: A tour of Maryborough in Queensland, and minor towns in the district, showing their life and industries in a brisk and unconventional way.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 030
results.brief_description: Two colourful magazine items set at opposite ends of Australia. The area around Mt. Gambier, South-eastern Australia is a tourist centre shown to advantage in this film with brilliant photography by Don McAlpine, some of it underwater in the Blue Lake. The second item is in Tipperary, in the Northern Territory, showing the first attempts to grow sorghum in virgin soil areas.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 029
results.brief_description: Shows aspects of Australian life: a report on the Orange (NSW) Field Day where farm equipment is demonstrated to the man on the land and the story of Norfolk Island, home of the descendants of the Bounty mutineers.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 028. Sydney Opera House
results.brief_description: Joern Utzon’s design for the Sydney Opera House is taking form in this newsreel program. The main concert hall with a 2,800 seating capacity, various drama theatres, rehearsal rooms, restaurants and other amenities are part of this exceptional building.
results.description: Joern Utzon’s design for the Sydney Opera House is taking form in this newsreel program. The main concert hall with a 2,800 seating capacity, various drama theatres, rehearsal rooms, restaurants and other amenities are part of this exceptional building.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 027
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine shows the ceremonial opening of Macquarie University in Sydney. A new pattern of study will enable students to participate in a variety of subjects in different faculties. Kathleen Geldard, member of the Australian Ballet Company describes her life of travel, rehearsals and performances.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 026
results.brief_description: Sydney artists Geoff Pike and Bob Booth exhibit their paintings on a floating gallery, the “One Step”, and profits from sales are to finance further their voyage around the Pacific Islands. Also featured is the launching of the Blue Streak Rocket from Woomera, the holiday resort of Forster on the New South Wales coast with its history, scenic surroundings and facilities.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 025
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and R.J. Edwards
results.brief_description: Magazine items: The Barossa Valley Vintage Festival in South Australia with a grand parade of floats depicting the heritage and achievements of the people; catamarans rate high in popularity among sailing enthusiasts; in Albany, Western Australia, Sir Robert Menzies unveils a memorial to the Desert Mounted Corps of World War 1.
